column6: I'm excited to have a Luke's Lobster near BK Heights.  ...and ther's now delivery!  The lobster rolls are simply delicious.
skip it. the size of the sandwich was puny. The flavor was not original. You probably can make a better lobster sandwich yourself.
No comment
COULD NOT BE BETTER. kind employees, cute seating area, and FANTASTIC food. the chicken and shrimp are my favorites but all are amazing. go at least once a week. LOVE

The nachos, chicken taco, and carnitas taco were all prepared fresh as we ordered and fantastic. My friend got the tortilla soup which was also said to be equally as good. Staff were very friendly and happy to help.
No comment

Small but chill joint with nice outdoor seating. Maybe not the most authentic Mexican food, but the chicken burrito bowl is really good for what it is! It's like chipotle but 100x better, as each ingredient is fresher and more flavorful. Friendly and efficient staff too.

Small little taco spot with bold flavors! This gem is right across from the seaport! I ordered a chicken taco with all the toppings available, plus a drizzle of the spicy mayo sauce--tortillas were very fresh too! Will be back again to try their Cajun shrimp taco (they ran out of it when I was there).

The food, the service, the portions, the happiness and aesthetics makes this place a gem! It's quality food, full servings, and really really good. I always pass this place and decided to stop in. The woman who allowed me to use Venmo, you're the best :). I will put all my co workers on to here and stop in again for my Carne Asada burrito!
No comment

Just happened to be passing this taco place and decided to give it a try. I had the grilled chicken nachos with red beans, pico de Gallo, cheese and spicy sauce. It was fresh, delicious and tasty. It very fulfilling and worth every penny. My friend had the chicken and corn. She said both we delectable.
No comment
Shrimp tacos are phenomenal! Flavor on point. Service is efficient and courteous. Go to quick-lunch spot in the area. Can't lose.
Great little spot for tacos ! Had steak and Chicken tacos with a variety of topping choices. Everything was delicious. I definitely recommend the nachos !!
No comment

I'm from the Bay Area where the burrito was invented, and lived in Los Angeles where it has the highest population of Hispanics, so Ive had a good amount of Mexican food, and I'll say Luchadores is the first Mexican restaurant I've liked in NYC. The burrito was good and they are always fast as well.

When the restaurants and bars starting opening back up, we ran straight to the City, straight to Seaport.  It was a beautiful Saturday afternoon, and Luchadores was open, with outdoor places you could rest your food on to eat.  We ordered a couple different tacos and quesadillas.  Everything was delicious.  There were a few of us, and the worker didn't have any issue keeping to all our different requests.  The siracha mayo is on point too!  My favorite might have been the fried fish, my friend, the shrimp.  I will say they are a little pricey, but they are also delicious.  One other big negative is, it takes FOREVER to get up to the front to order.  There were 5 orders in front of me, I didn't get to the front for a half hour.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Omg carne  Asada burrito and chips and guac were the perfect fit for my lunch. Amazing flavor and friendly staff.

This place was a hidden gem - the corn pop was an 11/10. Everything was amazing, and served quickly. Great vibe, even better food. Not pictured was the corn pop - too good for the camera to eat first.
No comment
No comment

My fiancé and I went to brunch this past Sunday and we arrived as the brunch crowd was winding down, which was great as the restaurant thinned out. The food was delicious, we had the fried chicken cordon blue and the smoked trout scrambled eggs. The bloody marys and bloody marias were also delicious.  However, as the brunch crowd was coming to an end, the staff started prepping and having meals in the back part of the restaurant. They also started sweeping the floor between the tables, which we found a little unprofessional. We're both ex restaurant workers. I also noticed someone who seemed to be a manager ask a waiter to speed up a table or ask what was taking them so long. All in all the experience was nice, but we could have done without watching the staff eat their meals and do their side work.
No comment
No comment

Cute little place. Tried their burger, mussels, po boy sandwich and potato and leek soup. All were very delicious except the mussels were a bit too mustardy for my taste. I would recommend going here if you are around the neighborhood. (No need to search it out).
No comment
No comment
Probably the most amazing place I've been in Brooklyn. Music is awesome, the staff are nothing short of amazing. I recommend it to everyone
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came for Saturday brunch with a reservation, which is a must-have because the place was packed!  Tried one of the benedicts and the french toast.  Very tasty and impressed by the serving amount.  We're so used to leaving brunch hungry that it was nice not to for once!!  Great service too.  We will be back for sure!

I throughly enjoyed my meal here. I came with a small group for restaurant week where I had the steak tartare, Le Grande Socca (chickpea flatbread), and pistachio parfait. I was looking at some of the reviews previous to mine saying it was nothing special, but I was amazed. The only thing I didn't enjoy as much was the chickpea flatbread mainly because I didn't like the flavor of the squash (that was just me personally). The steak tartare was delicious and the parfait I could distinctly taste the pistachio. I tried the steak from someone else's plate and I thought it was the best I'd ever had. I would definitely recommend it, despite that I didn't get the dish! And of course everything was beautifully exhibited as you can see from the pictures.
No comment

Worst service. Our waitress (dinner on 5/12) was nowhere in sight for most of the night (had to wait close to 45 minutes to even order our food) and we had to flag down multiple other waiters for anything.
No comment
No comment
No comment

nice casual french bistro in boerum hill. came here for restaurant week (RW) and the menu is rather extensive compared to lots of other RW offerings around the city. specifically, they offer lots of items that are actually ON their menu. I enjoyed the generous portions of mussels normande to start. could really taste the mustard at times. I couldn't decide between the trout and steak frites, but I succumbed to the steak frites. the bavette steak was nicely seasoned and cooked to a perfect medium. can't say the fries were that great though, but they were decent. my fellow yelper peter y let me try some of the trout and it was delish as well. finished off with the profiteroles which were a nice light dessert. overall, great meal in a charming setting.

Best brunch in the neighborhood and the wait time let's you know it's true.  Cocktails so tasty, hollandaise on point, fresh everything.  To the trout poboy I say thank you.  Crab, salmon and all the fishes delicious.  Really happy French Louie is in the area.

Always delicious. Excellent staff, true pros. Their menu is not too huge, and everything on it is excellent including all the wines. Terrific back garden seating. Chic, simple decir. Full disclosure: we know the owners. But we wouldn't say this stuff is it weren't true.

Visited French Louie with an old friend as a recommendation. Could not be happier with the service, atmosphere and of course the food. Whole night was fantastic and would recommend a visit to this lovely restaurant.

I went there for Valentine's Day dinner, and the food was AMAZING!!!! it was beyond my expectations, very well mannered staff. I had the bittersweet chocolate gateau for desert and my partner had the blood orange cheesecake, absolutely mouth watering. Well worth it for the price paid.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite brunch spot in Boerum Hill/ Brooklyn Heights area. The pastry of the day was divine! Brunch was fantastic, went back for dinner one evening unfortunately it was less impressive hence the 4 stars.
No comment
No comment
Very good taste and spacious outdoor sitting. Make sure you can handle spicy or ask them for mild spicy, because it's truly authentic Hunan style!!

I wish I took pictures of the food but everything was so delicious we devoured it all so quickly! We got the sour and spicy fish, chinese watercress, fried buns, twice cooked pork, fried rice, mapo tofu, and some others that I don't remember. Everything was decently spicy and perfectly seasoned! Our waiter (I think his name was Eric) was also amazing, he gave the best service, he was so nice and checked up on us often. Definitely a must try!
Good restaurant, went there for dinner, and the atmosphere is great. Price is not very expensive either.

All the dishes were so delicious. It's hard to pick just one that was really the winner. The salt and pepper shrimp was amazing as was Grandma's soup. Everyone must try the cucumbers and garlic green beans! They are a must.
Wonderful ambiance and great service. The food was a little spicy but Very delicious. I highly recommend for anyone visiting New York.

The staff was so accommodating especially with a large group of 15 people, they went out of their way to serve us and was very enthusiastic and efficient! Had so much fun celebrating my graduation with the family and thank you for the restaurant and especially Terry haha for making this such a great night!
the music is great. the food is DELICIOUS. the ambiance is amazing. and everything came out so fast
Excellent drinks and good vegetarian options like lao ma puffed tofu. Great ambience.

$80 worth of Hunan food delivered 8 minutes after order was placed. Everything was excellent, including chairman mao's braised pork, beef stew, snow pea shoot, and golden corn. Can't explain this greatness.

Excellent food! Best Hunan restaurant in midtown...maybe even all of Manhattan. We got the chive flowers, mapo tofu, Changsha chicken and ma ma fish. Everything was delicious and arrived super fast. Our server Terry was friendly and gave great recommendations!
We had such a wonderful late lunch today at Blue Willow. Their Szechuan flavors are the best in the city! Terry was our waiter and he provided excellent service!  Can't wait to come back next time.
Delicious food, loved the beef fried rice and the duck. Our server Tery was so friendly and accommodating. The hostess was also so sweet and got us a spot even though it was such a busy night
Everything was amazing. Everything was impeccable. Will definitely visit again. I am addicted to Sichuan crisp chili oil

Really great ambiance and decor. The food was really good, but nothing I had was mind blowing, which is fine. The specialty thousand year egg and eggplant dish was unique and something I had never tried before. A tad too spicy for me but great flavor. The garlic green beans had the ideal crispy texture and was definitely one of the better versions of that dish that I've had.

This place has been on my list for a while now, and so glad I came here. The food was pretty solid, especially the Peking duck, it hits the spot. The Qing Hua Jiao fish was quite oily but very flavorful, tasted really good with white rice. But overall food was great!!!
Really nice place! Thanks Terry for good help! I will recommend it to my friends. You can also take your children here.
No comment

Great place to get authentic Chinese food. I came with a group of 7 and we had a private room. Everyone enjoyed the food, even those who don't typically like spicy food. The ma po tofu and the mountain baked fish were especially good. Would definitely recommend!
Great place !! Food tasty and very fresh! Try Dan Dan noodles wonderful flavor. I lived in Shanghai China four three years and this restaurant rates 5 star China restaurant.
No comment
My food was delicious I really enjoyed the service as well and I recommend Terry for a great dining experience.

This restaurant is incredible. Beautiful 1920s decor, amazing Szechuan food that delivers bite after bite that makes you want to eat everything on the table while trying to keep the spice down by chugging water. Highly recommend the garlic string beans!! The best! Also the Lucky Golden Buns & Changsha Spiced chicken are not to be missed. Really friendly staff providing excellent service so shoutout to the whole team
Terry was an excellent waiter and the food here is so delicious!!!! I love the chrystanthemum tea and mapo tofu. I wish I could eat here all the time.
Love the restaurant. Really great vibes, great dry pot, and great vibes. Ask for terry, Terry was awesome with great service.
Very nice and authentic. The staff are polite and friendly. Portions are not big and not too small

I've been here a few times now. I've ordered delivery as well as dining in. The food is very good, and the restaurant could easily deserve a Michelin star. I would rank them a clear tier above Cafe China and other more high-end Chinese restaurants in the city. I do wish that their prices were less extreme, but you do get what you pay for.
Amazing service, outstanding food!! Highly recommend! Cleaned every plate  Terry was great!
No comment
No comment
We had a very nice dinner. I had peking duck. Very tasty but a little too fatty. My wife had the crispy beef which was amazing. The fried rice was just OK.
No comment
Excellent Szechuan and Chinese food in a great location.  Amazing cocktails. Terry our server was great too.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

Went here for early lunch, and got outdoor seats. So we cant rate on the place itself, which actually looks nice and unique from the outside. We ordered the tofu (a little salty, but tasted good), the fish with pickled vegetables (was good too), the shumai, and green beans and eggplants. Food was good, the portion is a little small compared to other chinese restaurant. Service was good. Recommended of you like authentic chinese food!
Live around the block, come here often. The food is great and authentic as someone who has been to Sichuan. Terry our waiter was also very friendly and helpful. Will always come back!

Decor was nice. Flavor for food was not bad at all. Only issue was that all the food that came out was not even hot. We ordered the stew and it was room temp... heard so many good things about this place. Disappointed everything served was cold...
Amazing authentic food. Servers are great. Terry is very nice! Great vibes, highly recommend. The music is also amazing.
Blue Willow always feels authentic to us and everyone enjoyed their meal.  The spicy dishes were indeed that and the dumplings were delicious if a tad over done.
Food came out quickly and outside seating was great. Eggplant garlic stir fry was excellent. Terry was a great server!
So delicious!! We loved our waiter Terry. Would highly recommend the soup dumplings and Peking duck.

Restaurant was beautifully decorated, giving an old Shanghai feel to the space. Food was super authentic. My  girlfriend was over the moon happy with the Hunan dishes. (She went to school in Hunan province in China). Service was superb! If you like "properly spicy" dishes (just ask them) this is also on point.
Beautiful outdoor dining area, you can tell they put thought and care into setting up a good dining experience.

Made a reservation a week before, then got hustled out 70 minutes after the reservation with the check on the table and the guy saying he's "so sorry" but there are people waiting. There was no one waiting? And there were empty tables? And any restaurant that doesn't plan for 90 minutes per table at least is doing something wrong. This was our big planned dinner for the weekend and it is ridiculous to pay this much for a meal when you aren't able to enjoy the full experience. Such a bummer.

Extremely poor Chinese food by city standards. Tried a handful of items and none were good. Would not try again given all the great Chinese food available.  Flavors were mild or non-existent, ingredients sub par. Portion sizes small and fairly expensive. All around poor.
This place was wonderful!!  Ambiance, food, staff all amazing!!  Packed house on a Saturday evening but the hostess was accommodating and polite!!

I have been here twice now and tried several dishes on the lunch menu. Each one is a hit! The restaurant is authentic, authentic Hunan food, so expect some serious spicy. Outdoor winter seating during COVID is so cute with individual heat lamps!

This place is very attractive and not overly pricey for the area. But we ordered 3 dishes and ALL of them were so salty we could barely eat them. We've eaten Sichuan food all over the city, but never had an experience like this. I was afraid the chicken with pickled peppers might be too spicy, but it wasn't. It was painfully salty. Also, all 3 dishes (1 beef, 1 chicken, 1 tofu) had the same boring red bell peppers in them, no other vegetables. Left half the food, didn't bother to take it home. Nope, won't be going back here :-(
Wow, just wow.  Stumbled in during a rainy evening mid week.  We were able to sit at the bar in the corner.  Fab ambiance. I could write poems about the duck.
Delicious!!! Recommending this place to all my friends. Favorites were their mapo tofu and Szechuan beef. Pumpkin Mochi dessert was also lovely

I've ordered from Blue Willow a few times and just haven't found anything that good. Maybe going in person is much better, or maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things, because other reviews are very positive.
